summary: This is a grand jury subpoena issued by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York on August 28, 2019. It commands the recipient to appear before the grand jury and produce all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, including communications and documents. The subpoena includes a rider detailing the recipient's rights and the scope of the requested materials.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.role: United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York
persons.context: Issued and signed the grand jury subpoena as the United States Attorney.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subpoena demands production of all materials relating to him as part of a grand jury investigation into alleged violations of federal law.

connections.description: Berman, as U.S. Attorney, is issuing a subpoena to gather evidence for a grand jury investigation into Epstein.

events.title: Issuance of Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York issued a grand jury subpoena to compel testimony and document production related to Jeffrey Epstein.

locations: United States Courthouse, 40 Foley Square, Room 220, Borough of Manhattan, City of New York, New York
One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: A grand jury subpoena was issued on August 28, 2019, by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, indicating an active federal investigation into Jeffrey Epstein post-arrest.
The subpoena demands the recipient's personal appearance before the grand jury and the production of all materials relating to Jeffrey Epstein, including electronic communications and documents.
The investigation concerns alleged violations of U.S. criminal codes including conspiracy (18 U.S.C. ยง 371), false statements (18 U.S.C. ยง 1001), and destruction of records (18 U.S.C. ยง 1519).
The subpoena's scope is extensive, covering materials on computers, email accounts, iCloud, servers, cellphones, and other devices, whether located in the U.S. or any foreign jurisdiction.
The document is signed by Geoffrey S. Berman, who was the U.S. Attorney overseeing the Epstein investigation at the time.
